intro: Endymion nutans, commonly known as the nodding endymion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its drooping, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces striking white to pale blue blooms with a strong, sweet fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Endymion nutans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
